metadata.title: CVE-2017-15691 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
In Apache uimaj prior to 2.10.2, Apache uimaj 3.0.0-xxx prior to3.0.0-beta, Apache uima-as prior to 2.10.2, Apache uimaFIT prior to 2.4.0,Apache uimaDUCC prior to 2.2.2, this vulnerability relates to an XMLexternal entity expansion (XXE) capability of various XML parsers. UIMA aspart of its configuration and operation may read XML from various sources,which could be tainted in ways to cause inadvertent disclosure of localfiles or other internal content.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-15691` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libuima-adapter-soap-java - 2.10.2-1
libuima-adapter-vinci-java - 2.10.2-1
libuima-core-java - 2.10.2-1
libuima-cpe-java - 2.10.2-1
libuima-tools-java - 2.10.2-1
libuima-vinci-java - 2.10.2-1
uima-examples - 2.10.2-1
uima-utils - 2.10.2-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: uimaj package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.10.2-1').
